definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions

sentences.english: Competitors are allowed to touch the first hold(s), without leaving the ground with both their feet.
sentences.chinese: 選手在雙腳未離地的情形下，得碰觸起攀點。

sentences.english: The pilot of the fighter plane even declares a near-collision.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥機的飛行員甚至還宣稱跟它有近距離碰觸。

sentences.english: Women also initiate touch more often than men do.
sentences.chinese: 女性也比男性更常先進行碰觸。

sentences.english: As soon as she touched the spindle she pricked her finger.
sentences.chinese: 一旦她碰觸了她刺了她的手指紗錠。

sentences.english: Yeah. Like when you get a sprain, you have a feeling of tenderness.
sentences.chinese: 好比，當你扭傷了手或腳關節，你會感到碰觸了就痛。

sentences.english: His hatred for Arcturus Mengsk has become a festering wound.
sentences.chinese: 他對蒙斯克的仇恨變成了他不可碰觸的傷口。

sentences.english: But he said he did not dare cross this “untouchable red line.
sentences.chinese: 但是他說，他不敢“碰觸這條紅線”。

sentences.english: Na:Each of these magical sigils needs to be touched at the same time in order to open the path to the talisman.
sentences.chinese: 那些魔符必須被同時碰觸，通往護符之路纔會開啓。

sentences.english: Metallophones such as glockenspiels produce sounds in response to contact.
sentences.chinese: 鐘琴等鐵器在被碰觸時會產生響應的聲音。

sentences.english: The touch of his hand was pleasant to her, and something deliciously more than pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 他那手的碰觸令她感到愉快，甚至美妙。

sentences.english: King Midas wished that everything he touched would turn into gold!
sentences.chinese: 邁達斯國王希望自己所碰觸的一切都能變成金子。

sentences.english: Remove the paper when the seedlings have grown up far enough to touch it.
sentences.chinese: 待生菜苗長到能夠碰觸到紙面時，將紙移去。

sentences.english: There are sharp "teeth" along the leaf margins, so place it where it can't be brushed accidentally.
sentences.chinese: 葉子邊緣成齒狀，所以應放在不容易碰觸到的地方。

sentences.english: He can never touch her again.
It is something I dare not to touch any more.
sentences.chinese: 這是我不敢再碰觸的一些東西。

definition: to touch/(fig.) to touch on (a matter)
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to be in a tangle/to nag
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
